newsitem.title: FRANCE: French truckers cause traffic chaos for second day.
newsitem.headline: French truckers cause traffic chaos for second day.

text.p: Truckers demanding more money and shorter working hours caused traffic chaos by blocking roads in cities and towns across France for the second day running on Tuesday.
All main access roads to Bordeaux in south-western France, whose mayor is Prime Minister Alain Juppe, were blocked by hundreds of lorries, local road traffic officials said.
Roadblocks also disrupted traffic in Caen, Rennes, and Le Mans in western France, on the Paris-Toulouse road, and in the south near Marseille among other areas.

In eastern France, protesters again cut off a bridge connecting France and Germany over the river Rhine at Strasbourg by parking trucks on either side of the border. Unlike yesterday, they did not allow private cars through.
Five trade unions and the independent FNCR truckers' federation had called a second day of protests after talks with Transport Minister Bernard Pons on Monday failed to resolve the dispute.
Adding to travellers' woes, snow, wind and rain hit traffic especially in the Lorraine, Alsace, Jura and France-Comte regions.
